meeting_context:
# North Star & Strategic Context

This file combines the overall project mission (North Star) and summaries of key strategic documents for use in AI prompts, particularly for the AI Agent Council context generation.

---

**North Star:**
To build a truly autonomous, sustainable DAO that develops open-source software accelerating the path toward AGI, blending AI researchers, open-source hackers, and crypto degens to create AI agents streaming, shitposting, and trading 24/7 on auto.fun to attract users and bootstrap an autonomous organization.

---

**ElizaOS Mission Summary (`docs/blog/mission.mdx`):**
The elizaOS mission is to build an extensible, modular, open-source AI agent framework for Web2/Web3, seeing agents as steps toward AGI. Core values are Autonomy, Modularity, and Decentralization. Key products include the framework itself, DegenSpartanAI (trading agent), Autonomous Investor/Trust Marketplace (social trading intelligence), and the Agent Marketplace/auto.fun (launchpad).

---

**ElizaOS Reintroduction Summary (`docs/blog/reintroduction.mdx`):**
elizaOS is an open-source "operating system for AI agents" aimed at decentralizing AI development away from corporate control. It's built on three pillars: 1) The Eliza Framework (TypeScript toolkit for persistent, interoperable agents), 2) AI-Enhanced Governance (building autonomous DAOs), and 3) Eliza Labs (R&D for future capabilities like v2, Trust Marketplace, auto.fun, DegenSpartanAI, Eliza Studios). The native Solana token coordinates the ecosystem and captures value. The vision is an intelligent internet built on open protocols and collaboration.

---

**Auto.fun Introduction Summary (`docs/blog/autofun-intro.mdx`):**
Auto.fun is an AI-native, creator-first token launchpad designed for sustainable AI/crypto projects. It aims to balance fair community access with project funding needs through mechanisms like bonding curves and liquidity NFTs. Key features include a no-code agent builder, AI-generated marketing tools, and integration with the elizaOS ecosystem. It serves as a core product driving value back to the native token ($ai16z) through buybacks and liquidity pairing.

---

**Taming Information Summary (`docs/blog/taming_info.mdx`):**
Addresses the challenge of information scattered across platforms (Discord, GitHub, X). Proposes using AI agents as "bridges" to collect, wrangle (summarize/tag), and distribute information in various formats (JSON, MD, RSS, dashboards, 3D shows). Showcases an AI News system and AI Assistants for tech support as examples. Emphasizes treating documentation as a first-class citizen to empower AI assistants and streamline community operations.
monthly_goal: Current focus: Stabilize and attract new users to auto.fun by showcasing 24/7 agent activity (streaming, trading, shitposting), ship production ready elizaOS v2.
daily_focus: The AI16Z to ElizaOS token migration has begun with exchange support but faces community confusion and technical implementation challenges that require immediate action.

key_points.summary: The AI16Z to ElizaOS token migration is underway but experiencing delays and communication challenges, creating confusion among community members despite exchange support from MEXC, Binance Alpha, Gate, and Bybit.

deliberation_items.text: What should be our priority focus to ensure a successful token migration experience?
context: Community members repeatedly asked about migration procedures for self-custody wallets
The migration process involves minimal gas fees and will remain open for 90 days

answer_1.text: Prioritize the technical implementation of the migration portal for self-custody wallets.
answer_1.implication: Technical focus may resolve the immediate bottleneck but could neglect communication needs of a confused community.

answer_2.text: Create comprehensive migration guides and documentation for different wallet types.
answer_2.implication: Documentation-first approach addresses user confusion but may not resolve underlying technical issues causing delays.

answer_3.text: Establish a dedicated migration support team and communication channel.
answer_3.implication: Support-focused strategy creates a responsive feedback loop but diverts resources from implementation and documentation.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: How should we leverage this migration to strengthen our ecosystem value proposition?
context: Tokens will be immediately tradeable after migration
cjft, Burn mentioned deploying liquidity pools for ElizaOS

answer_1.text: Position the migration as a catalyst for enhanced utility, immediately deploying liquidity pools and DEX integrations.
answer_1.implication: Technical utility focus may capture crypto-native users but could miss broader market positioning opportunity.

answer_2.text: Frame the migration as a rebranding milestone with refreshed messaging about agent capabilities and auto.fun integration.
answer_2.implication: Marketing-focused approach might generate excitement but risks disappointment if technical features aren't ready.

answer_3.text: Use the migration to launch a community incentive program tied to agent usage on auto.fun.
answer_3.implication: User engagement strategy directly supports the monthly goal but may complicate an already challenging migration process.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

key_points.summary: Recent GitHub activity and Discord discussions reveal a focus on enhancing developer experience through integration capabilities, security improvements, and runtime enhancements that align with the elizaOS v2 production goal.

deliberation_items.text: Which developer experience improvements should we prioritize for elizaOS v2?
context: Development of a "login with cloud" SDK is underway to enable seamless authentication across multiple applications
PR #5 to the otc-agent repository was merged
Discussion about plugin-sql dependencies and requests to release the plugin-elizacloud plugin

answer_1.text: Authentication and identity management across the ecosystem ("login with cloud" SDK).
answer_1.implication: Identity-focused approach creates cohesive user experience but requires coordination across multiple applications.

answer_2.text: Modular plugin architecture with stable APIs and comprehensive documentation.
answer_2.implication: Plugin architecture prioritization supports community extension but may slow delivery of core platform features.

answer_3.text: Developer tooling including debugging, monitoring, and deployment streamlining.
answer_3.implication: Tooling-first strategy enhances developer productivity but might not address fundamental platform capabilities.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: How should we balance security enhancements with feature development in the v2 release?
context: Work was started to implement entity-level row-level security
Sentry errors were dismissed as a non-issue from a single user

answer_1.text: Implement comprehensive security features (like entity-level RLS) as core v2 requirements before releasing new capabilities.
answer_1.implication: Security-first approach may delay release but establishes solid foundation for future growth.

answer_2.text: Develop and release features in parallel with security enhancements, with security flags for opt-in during beta.
answer_2.implication: Parallel development balances speed and security but increases complexity and testing requirements.

answer_3.text: Focus on minimal viable security for v2 release, with enhanced security features planned for post-launch updates.
answer_3.implication: Feature-first strategy accelerates time-to-market but could create technical debt or security vulnerabilities.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

key_points.summary: Recent discussions highlight tensions between technical implementation and community engagement, with suggestions to improve project communication, enhance social media presence, and create better educational resources to support auto.fun adoption.

deliberation_items.text: What community growth tactics would best support our goal of attracting new users to auto.fun?
context: Suggestions to improve project communication strategy and marketing
Add Telegram channels including Russian language support

answer_1.text: Expand to multiple communication channels with targeted content for different segments (Discord, Telegram, X).
answer_1.implication: Multi-channel strategy reaches diverse users but spreads resources thin and complicates information consistency.

answer_2.text: Focus on creating showcase agents that demonstrate 24/7 activity (trading, streaming, shitposting) on auto.fun.
answer_2.implication: Demonstration-focused approach directly supports monthly goal but requires significant technical resources.

answer_3.text: Develop comprehensive educational content explaining agent capabilities and tokenomics in non-technical terms.
answer_3.implication: Education-first strategy builds more informed users but may slow immediate adoption velocity.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: How should we bridge the gap between technical development and user experience to accelerate auto.fun adoption?
context: Plans to add an "Apps" section to Cloud where users can whitelist domains and link external apps
Coordination for promotional activities including a town hall featuring "Eliza agents"
Plans to stream promotion for an OpenSea collection called "Art Decc0s"

answer_1.text: Create no-code templates and starter kits for common agent use cases on auto.fun.
answer_1.implication: Template approach lowers barriers to entry but may lead to homogeneous agent ecosystem.

answer_2.text: Establish strategic partnerships with NFT collections and crypto communities for integration showcases.
answer_2.implication: Partnership strategy leverages existing communities but may dilute brand control and focus.

answer_3.text: Implement gamification elements that reward users for creating and interacting with agents.
answer_3.implication: Gamification drives engagement metrics but could attract users more interested in rewards than genuine platform value.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.
